lines.content: This is a project based on project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Nova/ui/Nova.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Nova.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Nova is a simple, interactive **task manager chatbot** that helps you keep track of tasks
such as Todos, Deadlines, and Events.
You can add tasks, mark them as done, search, and save them — all through natural text commands.
1. Ensure you have Java `17` or above installed.
2. Download the latest release of Nova.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder.
4. Open the command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in.
6. You should see the Nova welcome message:
What can I do for you?
7. Type the command in the terminal and press Enter to execute it. rg. typing `help`
and pressing Enter will show the list of command that can be used.
Adds a simple task without date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have * tasks in the list.
> **Note:** The `*` in the output will be replaced by the actual number of tasks currently in your list.
Add a task that has to be done by a certain date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have * tasks in the list.
> **Note:** The `*` in the output will be replaced by the actual number of tasks currently in your list.
Adds a task that starts and ends within a period of time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have * tasks in the list.
> **Note:** The `*` in the output will be replaced by the actual number of tasks currently in your list.
Shows the list of tasks in the task list.
### Marking tasks as Done / Not Done: `mark` `unmark`
Marks/Unmarks a certain task in task list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Delete a certain task in the task list.
Got it. I've deleted this task:
Now you have * tasks in the list.
> **Note:** The `*` in the output will be replaced by the actual number of tasks currently in your list.
Finds tasks that contains the keyword.
Here are matching tasks in your list:
Shows all the commands and formats that users can input.
Nova automatically **saves your tasks to a file**
after every change (adding, marking, unmarking, or deleting).
- The save file is located at: `[JAR file location]/NovaData/Nova.txt`
- The next time you start Nova, it will **load tasks from this file automatically**,
so you can continue where you left off.
* The entry point of the Nova application.
* - Initializes the Nova app with the data file path.
* - Starts the application by calling run().
* The main method that launches the Nova application.

throw new NovaException("Please use the format: deadline <desc> /by <DD/MM/YYYY HHmm>");

* Represents an abstract command in the Nova chatbot.
* Each command encapsulates a user action such as adding, deleting, ot listing
* tasks. Concrete command classes must implement the {@code execute} method.
* Executes the command with access to the task list, UI and storage.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the current tasks.
* @param ui The TextUi instance for displaying messages to the user.
* @param storage The Storage instance for saving/loading the updated task list.
* @throws NovaException If command cannot be executed due to invalid input
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, TextUi ui, Storage storage) throws NovaException;
* Returns whether this command signals the application to exit.
* By default, commands do not exit.
* @return {@code true} if this command ends the application,
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* The task is identified by its task numer in the displayed list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified argument.
* @param arguments The user input specifying which task number to delete.

*
  • Parses the task number from user input

*
  • Deletes the corresponding task from the task list

*
  • Updates the UI and storage with the change
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the current tasks.
* @param ui The TextUi instance for displaying messages to the user.
* @param storage The Storage instance for saving/loading the updated task list.
* @throws NovaException If the input is invalid or task number is out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, TextUi ui, Storage storage) throws NovaException {
throw new NovaException("Invalid task number! Please enter a number between 1 and " + tasks.getTasksSize());
* Represent a command to exit the Nova chatbot.
* When executed, this command will display the goodbye message
* and signal the application to terminate.
* Executes the exit command by showing a goodbye message to the user.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all current tasks (not used here).
* @param ui      The TextUi instance for interacting with the user.
* @param storage The Storage instance for saving/loading tasks (not used here).
* @throws NovaException This command does not throw any exceptions.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, TextUi ui, Storage storage) throws NovaException {
* Returns {@code true} to indicate that this command ends the application.
* @return {@code true}, since this command signals application termination.
* Represents a command to find tasks in the task list
* that match a given keyword in the task description.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The search keyword that user inputs.
* Executes the find command by searching keyword in the task list for
* tasks containing the keyword and displaying them to the user by the UI.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing all the tasks.
* @param ui The TextUi object used to interact with the user.
* @param storage The Storage object used for saving/loading tasks.
* @throws NovaException If the keyword is invalid or empty.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, TextUi ui, Storage storage) throws NovaException {
throw new NovaException("Invalid keyword! Please use this format: find <desc>");
* Represents a command that displays a list of available commands
* and their usage to the user.
* Executes the help command by printing all available commands
* and their descriptions to the console.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all current tasks (not used here).
* @param ui      The TextUi instance for interacting with the user.
* @param storage The Storage instance for saving/loading tasks (not used here).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, TextUi ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println(" Here are the available commands:");
System.out.println("   deadline <desc> /by <DD/MM/YYYY HHmm> - Add a deadline");
System.out.println("   event <desc> /from <DD/MM/YYYY HHmm> /to <DD/MM/YYYY HHmm> - Add an event");
System.out.println("   mark <num>          - Mark a task as done");
System.out.println("   unmark <num>        - Mark a task as not done");
System.out.println("   find <desc>         - Find a task by partial or full description");
System.out.println("   help                - Show this help message");
* Represents a command that lists all tasks in the current task list.
* If the task list is empty, shows a message.
* Otherwise, prints the number of tasks and their details.
* @param tasks   The TaskList containing all current tasks.

* @param storage The Storage instance for saving/loading tasks (not used here).

public void execute(TaskList tasks, TextUi ui, Storage storage) throws NovaException {
ui.showMessage(" No tasks in this list.");
System.out.println(" Number of tasks in this list: " + tasks.getTasksSize());
System.out.println(" Here are the tasks in your list:");
